Help
Mego Pro: Mego Pro is one of our MegoGrid module which helps you to integrate validation on your premium features that should be accessed in a limited way. Unlike giving complete and free access to a feature you can use this module to provide limited access to them and probe user to unlock it for its pro version. This module provides six types of validations which are as follows: Trial Days Access: This validation provides access to a feature for limited number of days. Once those days expired user will be prompted with \'Trial expired. All pro features are locked. Unlock it to use further.\' Count Usage Access: This validation provides access to a feature with specified number of clicks. If user exceed the clicks it will be locked and he has to unlock/buy it. Trial Days + Count Usage: This validation is the combination of above to validation types. Rest other things are same. Max Concurrent Access: This validation is used for the feature in your application which you have represented to the user in form of selection, where user can select as many as s/he can and then perform a single common operation on those selected items. Example of such representation is check boxes that you might have used in selecting images from Gallery or your custom selection of items where you want a common operation on them. This validation types has two subparts as follows:
Max Concurrent-Recurrence: Considering the above Concurrent Access scenario let us assume that we have maximum access of three items(3) for the given day. So according to the concurrent-Recurrence validation each time user will access the items within the limit of maximum access s/he is left with the total access minus the used items for the given day. And once he used all the maximum items access provided for the given day s/he can\'t access further any items for that day and can only access again on next day.
Max Concurrent-NonRecurrence: This validation is same as the Concurrent Recurrence. The only difference between this validation and above one is that user can use the maximum item provided at a time not more than that. That means s/he can use the given feature multiple times but maximum items at a time.
Max Individual: This validation is used for the feature in your app which has list of items that you show to the user either by using a ListView or GridView. Suppose you have N number of items in a list and you want to restrict the access of items to allow user to see only limited ones from the top-down manner. So here comes the rescue, this is the validation which will helps you.
